description:
Kabul is a city which has almost become used to gun attacks and bomb explosions. Many of the Afghans who've been among the migrants trying to reach Europe this summer have come from the capital. With the Taliban once more gaining ground in several parts of the country, the Americans have suspended their plans to withdraw troops from Afghanistan. Close to 10,000 US military personnel will now remain there at least until the end of the year. Babita Sharma Clear has been finding out in Kabul, not all Afghans believe the outlook for their country is bleak.

There is always the possibility of a bombing or an attack of some sort in Kabul, but that doesn't stop life going on. There is an air of tension, but also an everyday buzz. The commercial neighbourhood of Shinno is always bustling. On one side of the main street, there's a row of beauty salons. Surprisingly, their windows all feature pictures of uncovered immaculately made-up models. Women come here not just to get their hair and nails done, but also to get away from the outside world, from the fighting and the disapproving eyes of men.

A friend takes me to one of the salons. None of the women is covered up in here, but it's their manner that strikes me the most. The way they laugh and joke and seem completely at ease, in a way that's become recognisable to me, an all-female environment in a male-dominated society. I spot rows upon rows of different shades of pink nail polish before sitting down with XXXX, one of the women working there.
